name: speechV1
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Speech API.

First, install @google-cloud/speech with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/speech

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/speechâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var speech = require('@google-cloud/speech')();

Elsewhere

var speech = require('@google-cloud/speech')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/speech are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: streamingRecognize
methods.description: Performs bidirectional streaming speech recognition: receive results while sending audio. This method is only available via the gRPC API (not REST).

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration for the stream. This is appropriately wrapped and sent as the first argument. It should be an object conforming to the StreamingRecognitionConfig structure.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.
